entry.title: Components and singularities of Quot schemes and varieties of commuting matrices
entry.summary: We investigate the variety of commuting matrices. We classify its components for any number of matrices of size at most 7. We prove that starting from quadruples of size 8 matrices, this scheme has generically nonreduced components, while up to degree 7 it is generically reduced. Our approach is to recast the problem as deformations of modules and generalize an array of methods: apolarity, duality and Bia{\l{}}ynicki-Birula decompositions to this setup. We include a thorough review of our methods to make the paper self-contained and accessible to both algebraic and linear-algebraic communities. Our results give the corresponding statements for the Quot schemes of points, in particular we classify the components of $Quot_d(O_{\mathbb{A}^n}^{\oplus r})$ for $d\leq 7$ and all $r$, $n$.
